p: Between May and July 2018, some regions experienced hot days for up to 2 months, including Scandinavia, central Europe, and the United States (Figure 3a). The mean temperature anomaly of the hot days in these regions was up to 1.4 °C warmer than the 90th percentile daily temperatures in the reference period (Figure 3b). Owing to the associated exposure, heat wave impacts were particularly severe over the NH AgPop regions (see section 2.5).
